DS3 Manual
DS3: A System-Level Domain-Specific System-on-ChipSimulationFramework
Second Example

Table of Contents

  • Configuration file to run second example

For the second example in DS3, a workload composed of WiFi-TX and WiFi-RX applications (see Application configuration file) is executed in DS3.
First of all, a heterogeneous SoC with a total of 16 general-purpose cores and hardware accelerators is chosen for this example:

  • 4 big Arm Cortex-A15 cores,
  • 4 LITTLE Arm Cortex-A7 cores,
  • 2 matrix multiplier accelerators,
  • 4 FFT accelerator, and
  • 2 Viterbi decoder accelerators.

DS3 application benchmark suite has 6 reference design of real-world applications from wireless communications and radar domains on
two popular commercial heterogeneous SoC platforms: Xilinx Zynq ZCU102 UltraScale MpSoC and Odroid-XU3. These applications are:

  • WiFi-TX,
  • WiFi-RX,
  • Single-carrier transmitter (SCT)
  • Single-carrier receiver (SCR)
  • Temporal mitigation, and
  • Range detection

The table below gives the execution time profiling for WiFi-TX and WiFi-RX applications.

Execution time profiles of applications on Arm A7/A15 cores in Odroid-XU3, and hardware accelerators
Application Task Odroid A7 Odroid A15 FFT MM Viterbi
WiFi-TX Scrambler-Endoceder 22 us 10 us - - -
Interleaver 10 us 4 us - - -
QPSK Modulation 15 us 8 us - - -
Pilot Insertion 5 us 3 us - - -
Inverse-FFT 296 us 118 us 16 us - -
CRC 5 us 3 us - - -
WiFi-RX Match Filter 16 us 5 us - - -
Payload Extraction 8 us 4 us - - -
FFT 290 us 115 us 12 us - -
Pilot Extraction 5 us 3 us - - -
QPSK Demodulation 191 us 95 us - - -
Deinterleaver 16 us 9 us - - -
Decoder 1828 us 738 us - - 2 us
Descrambler 3 us 2 us - - -

For this specific workload, We use the parameters ( \(p_{RX} = 0.2, p_{TX} = 0.8\)) representing the probabilities for the new job being WiFi-RX, WiFi-TX.
In other words, for every 4 WiFi-TX applications and 1 WiFi-RX will be present in the workload.

Finally, when we executed the workload, DS3 outputs results in the following format (see Configuration file to run second example)

DS3 results for executing a WiFi TX/RX workload.

The above results is only for one frame rate under one scheduler. If DS3 is run for different frame rates (sweeping frame rates) under different scheduler,
The following results can be obtained for average execution time.

Results from different schedulers with a workload consisting of WiFi TX/RX
